pullRequest.body:
Also

- add `Matrix.transpose_stdBasisMatrix` and `conjTranspose` version
- add `Matrix.ext_ofMulVec`
- tag `Matrix.GeneralLinearGroup.map` with `@[simps]`

From "Formalizing the Bruhat-Tits tree"
Co-authored by: Judith Ludwig <ludwig@mathi.uni-heidelberg.de>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

</details>

bors d+

This is great, thanks! Please merge once CI passes.

bors d+

This is great, thanks! Please merge once CI passes.
@eric-wieser, opinions?
On `congr_fun` vs `congrFun`? I don't really care, because anyone who does care can write a linter to get rid of one of them later.

Here are the points I had in mind:
1. Are they good extensionality lemmas?
2. Should it be `ext_of_relevantDef` or `ext_relevantDef`?
3. Do those two exist in some form already?

1. Yes, but not good `@[ext]` lemmas
2. `of` seems better, `T.ext_fooHom` is usually for equality of `FooHom T _`. Perhaps it should be `ext_of_single_vecMul` or something.
3. Yes, but only via bundling that needs stronger typeclass assumptions:
```lean
import Mathlib
variable {m n R} [CommSemiring R] [Fintype m] [DecidableEq m] [Fintype n] [DecidableEq n]
open scoped Matrix

lemma ext_of_vecMul {M N : Matrix m n R} (h :  i, M * Pi.single i 1 = N * Pi.single i 1) :
    M = N := by
  apply Matrix.toLin'.injective
  ext : 2
  exact h _
-- or `Matrix.toLin'.injective <| LinearMap.pi_ext' fun i => LinearMap.ext_ring <| h i`
```
Renamed.
Hmm... I'm not a great fan of this lemma. Do you need it often?

1. Why are you not a "great fan"? It seems like a harmless `simp` lemma to me.
2. Only for showing that `swap * swap = 1` in the other PR.

My reasoning is that it is a straightforward combination of "Push multiplication inwards" + ` * .symm = 1`. Plus you need to push inwards through two functions, and there are many two functions compositions which you could try to pushing through inwards. This makes me lean towards "We don't want this, and instead users should `simp [ PEquiv.toMatrix_trans,  Equiv.toPEquiv_trans]` where needed".

If we have this lemma we should also have the one with the `symm` on the LHS of the multiplication.

Also, this should be stated for `m  n` not `m  m`
Deleted

```suggestion
lemma ext_of_mulVec [Fintype n] [DecidableEq n] {M N : Matrix m n } (h :  i, M * Pi.single i 1 = N * Pi.single i 1) :
    M = N := by
  ext i j
  simp_rw [mulVec_single_one] at h
  exact congrFun (h j) i
```
so as not to be consistent about using `Matrix m n` and not `Matrix n m` throughout the file.
Can you put `` into the binder at the top of the file?
Based on the lemmas above, I think these should remain in the `PEquiv` namespace, as they are about `PEquiv.toMatrix`
Is there a version of these lemmas you can state without `Pi.single`? I think the RHS would just be composition in that case - and then we can skip the `single` lemmas altogether.
Changed
I've just noticed; does the lemma on the line above this one generalize to `f : n  p` for free?
Yes.

```suggestion
    [Semiring ] (f : m  n) (M : Matrix n p ) :
```
There should be three variables here, not two.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Matrix): more lemmas for `PEquiv.toMatrix`
